node.title: Rotorua farm fined $27k for bush-grazing pigs
node.description: Rotorua's Kleadmak Farms has been fined $27,000 after pigs were found grazing in native bush and effluent discharged into Umurua Stream.

node.title: Abortion Views, and Personal Stories
node.description: Readers’ responses to recent Opinion pieces include accounts of their own abortions and a grandmother’s death after an illegal procedure.

node.title: Will Lawmakers Do Anything to Protect the 2024 Election?
node.description: The Electoral Count Act needs fixing. Now.

node.title: Queen Elizabeth II to mark 70 years on the British throne
node.description: It was on February 6, 1952, when a then 25-year-old Elizabeth was first crowned following the death of her father.

node.title: Joe Rogan Apologizes for ‘Shameful’ Past Use of Racial Slur
node.description: His apology came as listeners said that as many as 70 episodes of “The Joe Rogan Experience” podcast had been quietly taken off Spotify; the company has yet to comment on the reported removals.

node.title: Rescuers fear for life of 5-year-old boy trapped in a well
node.description: Rescuers used a rope to send oxygen and water down to the boy as well as a camera to monitor him.

node.title: Gas prices reach record highs in Orange and Los Angeles counties
node.description: One man paid $25 for just five gallons.

node.title: Shaun White says Beijing Olympics will be his final competition
node.description: The three-time gold medalist made it clear that not only will the Beijing Games be his last Olympics — they'll mark his final contest, too.

node.title: Michael Lewis Revisits ‘Liar’s Poker’
node.description: The book documented the reckless, frat-guy culture of investment banking in the 1980s. DealBook talked with Mr. Lewis about how Wall Street has (and hasn’t) changed since.

node.title: Shaun White reaffirms snowboarding’s worst-kept secret: This is his last Games.
node.description: White, 35, had previously said he would end his Olympic career in Beijing. On Saturday, he said the Games will mark his retirement from competition.

node.title: Minneapolis mayor halts no-knock warrants after death of Amir Locke
node.description: "To ensure safety of both the public and officers until a new policy is crafted, I'm issuing a moratorium on both the request and execution of such warrants in Minneapolis," said Mayor Jacob Frey.

node.title: Rules helping foreign investors turn NZ farmland into forestry reviewed
node.description: Figures provided to RNZ by the Overseas Investment Office (OIO) show in the last three years 36,000 hectares of farmland has been approved for sale to overseas investors under the special forestry…

node.title: Victoria's Covid hospitalisations at 687 as state records 41 deaths and 7810 new cases
node.description: Victoria has recorded the deaths of a further 41 Covid-19 patients.

node.title: Family says DNA ancestry kit shows daughter was conceived with wrong sperm
node.description: A US family is suing a fertility clinic, alleging their daughter was conceived using the wrong sperm — a 30-year-old mistake only revealed when she received a DNA ancestry kit for Christmas.

node.title: 'I haven't slept a wink' - Morocco well rescue for five-year-old grips nation
node.description: Rescuers who are desperately trying to reach a five-year-old boy who fell into a well in northern Morocco four days ago say they are "almost there".

node.title: Netball: Michaela Sokolich-Beatson won't let fear stop her
node.description: They say an elite sporting career is a short one - Northern Mystics netballer Michaela Sokolich-Beatson knows that only too well.

node.title: SA records two COVID deaths and 1,289 new cases
node.description: Two women aged in their 80s have died from COVID-19 in South Australia, which today reported 1,289 new cases.

node.title: U.S. broadcast coverage on Saturday continues with curling, speedskating and hockey.
node.description: The first medals in biathlon, short track and skiing events at the Beijing Games will be up for grabs.

node.title: Planning for the 2026 Winter Games is already underway.
node.description: Milan and Cortina d’Ampezzo, Italy, will host the next event, where two million visitors are expected.

node.title: Joyce says Morrison declined his offer to resign after calling the PM a 'hypocrite and a liar'
node.description: Australia's Deputy Prime Minister Barnaby Joyce says he offered to resign after an explosive text message he wrote last year calling Prime Minister Scott Morrison a "hypocrite and a liar" was exposed.

node.title: The January 6 trial that will set the standard for hundreds to follow
node.description: Guy Reffitt, charged with bringing a firearm to the Capitol attack, will be the first alleged rioter to face a jury, as the ongoing pandemic complicates his high-profile case.

node.title: Waitangi National Trust head pleased by response to cancellations
node.description: The chair of the Waitangi National Trust says he's pleased by the response to the cancellation of in-person events at Waitangi this year.

node.title: Trust to appeal mānuka honey trademark rejection
node.description: The New Zealand honey industry has decided to appeal against the UK Intellectual Property Office's decision to decline its mānuka honey trademark application.

node.title: No 10 denies Boris Johnson has lost control after raft of resignations
node.description: Boris Johnson still has control of Downing Street after a string of close aides quit their jobs, his official spokesman has insisted.

node.title: Anger over super trawler spill of 100,000 dead fish off French coast
node.description: Dutch-owned trawler FV Margiris, the world's second-biggest fishing vessel, shed more than 100,000 dead fish into the Atlantic Ocean off France, forming a floating carpet of carcasses that environmental campaigners have seen.

node.title: North Carolina Supreme Court orders redrawing of congressional map
node.description: It's the third state that's been ordered by the courts to redraw its lines.

node.title: CDC to ramp up wastewater monitoring program to track COVID-19
node.description: The data from wastewater samples can help communities detect the virus early on.

node.title: Importance of nutrition for cancer patients highlighted in new report
node.description: New research suggests nutrition plays an important role in caring for patients with cancer during and after treatment.

node.title: New research shows how color could help stave off mosquitoes
node.description: Mosquito bites are an unfortunate inevitability of summertime — or are they?

node.title: Cut off by floods and with shelves bare, rumblings are growing in the NT about food security
node.description: When the Sharps ordered groceries from COVID isolation in Darwin this week and all they could get was a tin of pineapple chunks, they and the rest of the Top End realised they had a serious problem.
